org.eleusoft.uri.util
Class URIQuery

java.lang.Object
  org.eleusoft.uri.util.URIQuery

public final class URIQuery
extends java.lang.Object

A class to parse the parameters present in the Query String of an URI, supports different separators.

The default separator is & and the default value-separator is =, the default encoding is UTF-8.

Author:
mik

Nested Class Summary
static class URIQuery.Param
          Value object that represents a parameter of the query string and its value.

Method Detail

getException

public java.lang.Exception getException()
Retrieves the last, if any, exception catched parsing values. Values are parsed all also if one is invalid, the invalid param gets the invalid value not percent decoded.

getParams

public java.util.Enumeration getParams()
Retrieves an enumeration of URIQuery.Param

Returns:
A Enumeration, never null.

getParameterValue

public java.lang.String getParameterValue(java.lang.String name)
Retrieves the first value of the parameter with decoded name as passed, the value is returned percent decoded, or if is impossible to percent-decode the value, as found in the request.

Parameters:
name - A String, never null.
Returns:
A String or null.

getParameterValue

public static java.lang.String getParameterValue(java.lang.String uri,
                                                 java.lang.String name)
                                          throws URIException
Static helper to perform a very common operation: get a single parameter value in a single shot from a string URI.

Parameters:
uri - A String, never null.
name - A String, never null.
Returns:
A String or null.
Throws:
URIException
